actions.name: Authenticate as Racker
actions.description: Authenticate as Racker.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<auth xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:RAX-AUTH="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0" 
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <passwordCredentials password="mypassword" username="jqsmith"/>
 <RAX-AUTH:domain name="Rackspace"/>
</auth>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<auth xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:RAX-AUTH="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0" 
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <RAX-AUTH:rsaCredentials tokenKey="8723984574" username="jqsmith"/>
 <RAX-AUTH:domain name="Rackspace"/>
</auth>

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<access xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0" 
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <token expires="2012-04-13T08:15:00.000-05:00" id="aaaaa-bbbbb-ccccc-dddd"/>
 <user name="jqsmith">
 <roles>
 <role name="Racker"/>
 <role name="UVC_ServiceUsers"/>
 <role name="Support"/>
 </roles>
 </user>
</access>

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Create a Secret Q&A
actions.description:
Create a secret question and answer for a user. 
 Clients must specify the question ID, question, and answer in the request body.

actions.name: Get User Secret Q&A List
actions.description:
Get a list of secret questions and answers for a user. 
 The operation returns a list of questions and answers for a user.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<secretqas
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <secretqa answer="Himalayas" id="1" question="What is the location of a dream vacation?"/>
</secretqas>

userId.description: The user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Get User Admin
actions.description:
Get user admin. 
 This request returns a single user. The request allows users within an
 account who are user-admins (identity: user-admin) or account users (identity: default) to locate the
 administrator/point of contact of their account if they have questions or need assistance regarding user
 and/or role management. This request provides identifying information about the administrator including
 domain name, domain ID, email address, status, user ID and user name.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<users xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" 
 xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"
 xmlns:os-ksadm="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0" 
 xmlns:rax-ksqa="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-KSQA/v1.0" 
 xmlns:rax-kskey="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-KSKEY/v1.0" 
 xmlns:os-ksec2="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSEC2/v1.0" 
 xmlns:rax-auth="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0">
 <user id="10022879" 
 username="JuserAdmin" 
 enabled="true" 
 display-name="JuserAdmin" 
 rax-auth:defaultRegion="USA" 
 rax-auth:domainId="5701091"/>
</users>

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Get Accessible Domains
actions.description:
Gets a list of accessible domains. 
 The operation returns a list of domains to which the user has access. A user has access to a domains if
 the user has a role in a tenant that exists in the domain.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<domains
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <domain enabled="true" id="9883948" name="GCorp">
 <description>A very good customer</description>
 </domain>
 <domain enabled="true" id="111" name="Azuri">
 <description>High profile</description>
 </domain>
 <domain enabled="true" id="222" name="GCorp"/>
 <atom:link
 href="https://identity.api.rackspaecloud.com/v2.0/RAX-AUTH/domains?marker=27872354&limit=3" rel="prev"/>
 <atom:link
 href="https://identity.api.rackspaecloud.com/v2.0/RAX-AUTH/domains?marker=9883948&limit=3" rel="next"/>
</domains>

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Update Settings for Multifactor Settings
actions.description:
Update Settings for Multifactor Settings. 
 
 Once you have created a mobile phone for multifactor authentication, have sent the verification code to 
 that phone, and have verified receipt of the code, this operation enables multifactor authentication for you. To 
 start using the mobile phone, set the enable attribute to true. To stop 
 using the mobile phone, set the enable attribute to false.

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Create a Mobile Phone
actions.description:
Create a Mobile Phone that can be used for multifactor authentication. 
 This operation allows you to indicate what mobile phone number you want to use for multifactor 
 authentication.

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Send Verify Code to a Mobile Phone
actions.description:
Send a verification code to a device to verify the user has possession of the device.
 Once you have created the mobile phone for multifactor authentication, this operation sends an SMS message 
 with the verification code to the mobile phone number you provided.

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Verify a Device
actions.description:
Verify that the caller is in possession of the multifactor authentication device. 
 Once you have created a mobile phone for multifactor authentication and have sent the verification code to 
 that phone, this operation allows you to provide the code to the Cloud Identity service to verify that have the
 phone and have actually received the code.

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Reset User APIKey
actions.description:
Reset a user's API Key 
 We recommend that you routinely reset passwords and API keys. This API
 key reset call will return the new API key for the user account. Unlike updating the password, the API key
 reset does not revoke existing tokens. The "Revoke Token" call can be used to revoke a token.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<apiKeyCredentials apiKey="aaaaa-bbbbb-ccccc-12345678"
 username="jqsmith"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-KSKEY/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Get Policies
actions.description: Get all policies for endpoint template.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policies algorithm="if-false-deny"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <policy enabled="true" global="false" id="2" name="nova policy" type="nova-json-policy-format"/>
 <policy enabled="true" global="false" id="122"
 name="admin policies" type="standard-policy-format"/>
</policies>

actions.name: Update Policies
actions.description:
Update all policies for endpoint template 
 This allows clients to update all the policies for an endpoint template at once.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policies algorithm="if-false-deny"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <policy id="2"/>
 <policy id="122"/>
</policies>

actions.name: Add Policy
actions.description: Add a Policy to an endpoint template.

actions.name: Remove Policy
actions.description: Remove a policy from an endpoint template.

X-Auth-Token.description: A valid authentication token for the impersonator

actions.name: Impersonate User
actions.description:
Impersonate a specific user. 
 To impersonate a user, you must first authenticate as yourself. The
 response to this authentication request will supply you with a current Racker token; you must already hold a
 service token. After you are authenticated and holding the necessary privileges, you can issue this
 impersonation call with your Racker token, identifying the username you wish to impersonate. 
 You can specify the number of seconds you want the impersonation to
 remain valid. For example, <expire-in-seconds>10800</expire-in-seconds> asks for
 10,800 seconds (180 minutes, or 3 hours) of impersonation. Whether or not you requested a specific expiration
 time, your impersonation period will be limited. The response to your impersonation request will include the
 time at which the impersonation becomes invalid. 
 
 
 In an impersonation request, express your request for time as a number of
 seconds. 
 
 
 In an impersonation response, the expiration time granted to you is expressed
 as a timestamp. 
 
 
 A successful impersonation request returns a token and an expiration
 time for that token. You can impersonate username by supplying that token in other requests,
 until the token expires.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<access xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <token expires="2011-09-08T07:00:00.000-05:00" 
 id="xxx-yyy-zzz-kwejKId893KJDKJKSKJSM"/>
</access>

actions.name: Get token by SAML assertion
actions.description:
Get a token by SAML assertion.
 Cloud Identity supports identity federation through the implementation of the SAML 2 protocol. Using this 
 protocol, you can provide an XML assertion indicating that the identity is already authenticated via a trusted 
 identity provider. Cloud Identity will return a token in response.
 
 
 
 The request must be formatted as XML, but the response may be either in XML or JSON format.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<saml2p:Response xmlns:saml2p="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol"
 ID="cedee8c1-22b7-45dc-8dbf-eeb107175eaa" IssueInstant="2013-11-15T16:19:06.313Z"
 Version="2.0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
 <saml2:Issuer xmlns:saml2="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion">http://my.rackspace.com
 </saml2:Issuer>
 <ds:Signature xmlns:ds="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">
 <ds:SignedInfo>
 <ds:CanonicalizationMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#" />
 <ds:SignatureMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1" />
 <ds:Reference URI="#cedee8c1-22b7-45dc-8dbf-eeb107175eaa">
 <ds:Transforms>
 <ds:Transform
 Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature" />
 <ds:Transform Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#">
 <ec:InclusiveNamespaces xmlns:ec="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#"
 PrefixList="xs" />
 </ds:Transform>
 </ds:Transforms>
 <ds:DigestMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1" />
 <ds:DigestValue>LtawRPe105g7JDDfbwGrrKQ6/Lk=</ds:DigestValue>
 </ds:Reference>
 </ds:SignedInfo>
 <ds:SignatureValue>lm+bWLfJO15VEPcGHnJkgLSPXPe+ckPWCDfnvd9UteeL7A8xvSJBb4YGYUIwPqgM9PZU6RTRVmfsM85/Jo4/xA==
 </ds:SignatureValue>
 </ds:Signature>
 <saml2p:Status>
 <saml2p:StatusCode Value="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:status:Success" />
 </saml2p:Status>
 <saml2:Assertion xmlns:saml2="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion"
 ID="406fb7fe-a519-4919-a42c-f67794a670a5" IssueInstant="2013-11-15T16:19:06.310Z"
 Version="2.0">
 <saml2:Issuer>http://my.rackspace.com</saml2:Issuer>
 <saml2:Subject>
 <saml2:NameID Format="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified">john.doe</saml2:NameID>
 <saml2:SubjectConfirmation Method="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:cm:bearer">
 <saml2:SubjectConfirmationData
 NotOnOrAfter="2013-11-17T16:19:06.298Z" />
 </saml2:SubjectConfirmation>
 </saml2:Subject>
 <saml2:AuthnStatement AuthnInstant="2013-11-15T16:19:04.055Z">
 <saml2:AuthnContext>
 <saml2:AuthnContextClassRef>urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:PasswordProtectedTransport
 </saml2:AuthnContextClassRef>
 </saml2:AuthnContext>
 </saml2:AuthnStatement>
 <saml2:AttributeStatement>
 <saml2:Attribute Name="roles">
 <saml2:AttributeValue xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
 xsi:type="xs:string">identity:default</saml2:AttributeValue>
 </saml2:Attribute>
 <saml2:Attribute Name="domain">
 <saml2:AttributeValue xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
 xsi:type="xs:string">323676</saml2:AttributeValue>
 </saml2:Attribute>
 </saml2:AttributeStatement>
 </saml2:Assertion>
</saml2p:Response>

responses.body:

 id="161418" name="john.doe" rax-auth:defaultRegion="DFW">

 description="Customer account user"/>

 </user>

 />

actions.name: Get Default Region Services
actions.description: Gets the list of services that restrict the default regions their users can set.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<defaultRegionServices
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <serviceName>cloudFiles</serviceName>
 <serviceName>openstackNova</serviceName>
</defaultRegionServices>

actions.name: Set Default Region Services
actions.description:
Sets the list of services that restrict the default regions their users can set. 
 Users can modify their own default regions, but only within limits.
 Those limits are imposed by the services in the user's service catalog. Each service specifies the default
 region for its users. For example, if the openstackNova service sets its default region to
 ORD, then any user whose service catalog includes the openstackNova service can
 only set their default region to ORD.

actions.name: Get Domains
actions.description:
Gets a list of domains. 
 The operation returns a list of domains for which the supplied token provides access. Tokens have
 access to domains by the token having access to a tenant that exists in the domain. If the token belongs to
 an admin user, a list of all domains may be returned.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<domains
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <domain enabled="true" id="9883948" name="GCorp">
 <description>A very good customer</description>
 </domain>
 <domain enabled="true" id="111" name="Azuri">
 <description>High profile</description>
 </domain>
 <domain enabled="true" id="222" name="GCorp"/>
 <atom:link
 href="https://identity.api.rackspaecloud.com/v2.0/RAX-AUTH/domains?marker=27872354&limit=3" rel="prev"/>
 <atom:link
 href="https://identity.api.rackspaecloud.com/v2.0/RAX-AUTH/domains?marker=9883948&limit=3" rel="next"/>
</domains>

actions.name: Create a Domain
actions.description:
Create a domain. 
 Clients must specify the domain ID in the request body.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<domain enabled="true" id="9883948" name="GCorp"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <description>A very good customer</description>
</domain>

actions.name: Get a Domain
actions.description: Get a domain.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<domain enabled="true" id="9883948" name="GCorp"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <description>A very good customer</description>
</domain>

actions.name: Update a Domain
actions.description: Update a domain.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<domain enabled="true" id="9883948" name="GCorp"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <description>A very good customer</description>
</domain>

actions.name: Delete a Domain
actions.description:
Delete a domain. 
 This operation fails unless no entities such as users and tenants exist in this domain. Only an empty
 domain can be deleted.

actions.name: Get Users in Domain
actions.description: Get users in a domain.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<users xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0" 
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <user email="john.smith@example.org" enabled="true" id="123456" username="jqsmith"/>
 <user email="mike.turner@example.org" enabled="true" id="388493" username="miketurner"/>
 <user email="poe.joe@example.org" enabled="false" id="938439" username="poejo"/>
</users>

userId.description: A user ID assigned by system when user is added.

actions.name: Add User to Domain
actions.description:
Add a user to a domain. 
 A user can exist in only one domain at a time. When you add a user to a domain, the user is
 automatically removed from any prior domain.

actions.name: Get Tenants in Domain
actions.description:
Get tenants in a domain. 
 Tenants can be used to create logical organization within a domain. For example, an entertainment
 business might use two tenants to separately identify resources related to two kinds of activity: manage Star Wars
 games and manage Star Wars pictures.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tenants xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <tenant display-name="Star Wars" enabled="true" id="5784574" name="star_wars">
 <description>Used to manage the Star Wars games</description>
 </tenant>
 <tenant display-name="Star Wars" enabled="true" id="Mosso_73843_FS" name="star_wars_pictures">
 <description>Used to manage the pictures for Star Wars</description>
 </tenant>
</tenants>

actions.name: Add Tenant to Domain
actions.description:
Add a tenant to a domain. 
 A tenant can only exist in one domain at a time. When you add a tenant to a domain, the tenant is
 automatically removed from any prior domain.

actions.name: Get Endpoints for Domain
actions.description:
Get endpoints restricted to a domain. 
 This operation returns a list of domain endpoints for which the supplied token provides access. If a token 
 has access to a tenant that exists in the domain, then the token has access to the domain. If the token belongs 
 to an admin user, a list of all domain endpoints may be returned.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<endpoints xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <endpoint
 adminURL="https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/2882983"
 id="4"
 internalURL="https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/2882983"
 name="cloudServersOpenStack"
 publicURL="https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/2882983"
 region="DFW" tenantId="2882983" type="compute">
 <version id="1"
 info="https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2" list="https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com"/>
 </endpoint>
 <endpoint id="5"
 internalURL="https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com/v1/MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeee"
 name="cloudFiles"
 publicURL="https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com/v1/MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeee"
 region="ORD"
 tenantId="MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeee" type="objectStore">
 <version id="1"
 info="https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com/v1" list="https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com"/>
 </endpoint>
</endpoints>

{
 "OS-KSCATALOG:endpoints": [
 {
 "tenantId": "2882983",
 "region": "DFW",
 "id": 4,
 "publicURL": "https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/2882983",
 "name": "cloudServersOpenStack",
 "adminURL": "https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/2882983",
 "type": "compute",
 "versionId": "1",
 "versionInfo": "https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2",
 "versionList": "https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com"
 },
 {
 "tenantId": "MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeee",
 "region": "ORD",
 "id": 5,
 "publicURL": "https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com/v1/MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeee",
 "name": "cloudFiles",
 "type": "objectStore",
 "versionId": "1",
 "versionInfo": "https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com/v1",
 "versionList": "https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com",
 "internalURL": "https://storage101.ord1.clouddrive.com/v1/MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeee"
 }
 ]
}

actions.name: Get All Policies
actions.description: Get all Policies.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policies algorithm="if-false-deny"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <policy enabled="true" global="false" id="2" name="nova policy" type="nova-json-policy-format"/>
 <policy enabled="true" global="false" id="122"
 name="admin policies" type="standard-policy-format"/>
</policies>

actions.name: Create a Policy
actions.description: Create a policy.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policy
 blob="{context_is_admin: [[role:admin]],admin_or_owner: [[is_admin:True], [project_id:%(project_id)s]],default: [[rule:admin_or_owner]]}"
 enabled="true" global="false" name="nova policy"
 type="nova-json-policy-format"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <description>This is policy defined for all users of the nova api</description>
</policy>

actions.name: Get a Policy
actions.description: Gets a policy.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policy
 blob="{context_is_admin: [[role:admin]],admin_or_owner: [[is_admin:True], [project_id:%(project_id)s]],default: [[rule:admin_or_owner]]}"
 enabled="true" global="false" id="2" name="nova policy"
 type="nova-json-policy-format"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <description>This is policy defined for all users of the nova api</description>
</policy>

actions.name: Update a Policy
actions.description: Update a Policy.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policy
 blob="{context_is_admin: [[role:admin]],admin_or_owner: [[is_admin:True], [project_id:%(project_id)s]],default: [[rule:admin_or_owner]]}"
 enabled="true" global="false" name="nova policy"
 type="nova-json-policy-format"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <description>This is policy defined for all users of the nova api</description>
</policy>

actions.name: Delete a Policy
actions.description:
Delete a policy. 
 A policy can only be deleted if it is not tied to any entity.

actions.name: Get Detailed Policy Content
actions.description:
Gets a policy content. 
 The representation of the policy is different from the author's perspective and the policy enforcer's
 perspective. This API is intended for policy enforcers; it gives clear, fully detailed, non-verbose
 descriptions of the policy.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<policy xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/policy/v1.0">
 <rule>
 <subject roles="default"/>
 <capabilities serviceType="compute" version="2.0">
 <capability action="GET" id="2378237"
 name="create-server" url="/servers"/>
 <capability action="GET" id="545454" name="get_servers" url="/servers"/>
 <capability action="GET" id="23892323" name="get_server" url="/servers/{serverId}"/>
 <capability action="PUT" id="10920192"
 name="update-server" url="/servers/{serverId}"/>
 <capability action="POST" id="272738723"
 name="stop-server" url="/servers/{serverId}/stop"/>
 </capabilities>
 </rule>
 <rule>
 <subject id="jbryce"/>
 <capabilities serviceType="compute" version="2.0">
 <capability action="GET" id="23892323" name="get_server" url="/servers/{serverId}">
 <attribute name="tenantId" value="5473"/>
 <attribute name="tenantId" value="99999"/>
 </capability>
 </capabilities>
 <capabilities serviceType="swift" version="2.0">
 <capability action="GET" id="378343" name="get-file" url="/containers/{containerId}/{filename}"/>
 </capabilities>
 </rule>
</policy>

actions.name: Get Regions
actions.description:
Gets a list of regions. 
 The operation returns a list of regions.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<regions
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <region enabled="true" isDefault="true" name="DFW"/>
 <region enabled="true" isDefault="false" name="ORD"/>
</regions>

actions.name: Create a Region
actions.description:
Creates a region. 
 Clients must specify the region name in the request body. 
 Clients must specify whether or not the region is default in the request body. When a user is created,
 they are assigned the default region based on which region is set as isDefault:true. This is used to assist
 Next Gen Compute capacity by suggesting to new users that they provision where we want them to. The user can
 change their default region through the update user API call, but they are restricted to changing it only to
 one of their regions listed in the service catalog for the CloudServersOpenStack service.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<region enabled="true" isDefault="true" name="DFW"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Get a Region
actions.description: Gets a region.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<region enabled="true" isDefault="true" name="DFW"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Update a Region
actions.description: Updates a region.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<region enabled="true" isDefault="true" name="DFW"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" 
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Delete a Region
actions.description:
Deletes a region. 
 This request will only succeed if the region default is set to false. The default value must be false
 before this operation will be allowed.

actions.name: Get Questions
actions.description:
Get a list of questions. 
 The operation returns a list of questions.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<questions
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <question id="1" question="What is the location of a dream vacation?"/>
 <question id="2" question="Where is the best place to live?"/>
</questions>

actions.name: Create a Question
actions.description:
Create a question. 
 Clients must specify the question name in the request body.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<question question="What is the location of a dream vacation?"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Get a Question
actions.description: Get a question.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<question id="1" question="What is the location of a dream vacation?"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Update a Question
actions.description: Update a question.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<question id="1" question="What is the location of a dream vacation?"
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:OS-KSADM="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/ext/OS-KSADM/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0"/>

actions.name: Delete a Question
actions.description:
Delete a question. 
 This request will only succeed if the question is not assigned to any users. The question must be
 removed from any users before this operation will be allowed.

actions.name: Get Service APIs
actions.description: Gets a list of service APIs.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<serviceApis
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0">
 <serviceApi type="compute" version="1.0"/>
 <serviceApi type="compute" version="2.0"/>
 <serviceApi type="object-store" version="2.0"/>
 <serviceApi type="rax:customer" version="1"/>
</serviceApis>

type.description: The service type e.g. compute, object-store, rax-dns.

version.description: The service version e.g v1, v2.0, ...

actions.name: Get Capabilities
actions.description: Get the capabilities for an endpoint template.

responses.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<capabilities
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <capability action="GET" id="get_servers" name="get_servers" url="/servers"/>
 <capability action="GET" id="get_server" name="get_server" url="/servers/{serverId}"/>
 <capability action="POST" id="stop_server" name="stop_server" url="/servers/{serverId}/stop"/>
</capabilities>

actions.name: Update Capabilities
actions.description:
Update the capabilities for a Service API. 
 Any capabilities that previously existed for this endpoint template will be overridden. There will be
 future support to update capabilities by specifying a WADL as the payload. A WADL describes all the
 capabilities that can exist for a service.

requests.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<capabilities
 xmlns="http://docs.rackspace.com/identity/api/ext/RAX-AUTH/v1.0"
 xmlns:identity="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v2.0" xmlns:ns3="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
 <capability action="GET" id="get_servers" name="get_servers" url="/servers"/>
 <capability action="GET" id="get_server" name="get_server" url="/servers/{serverId}"/>
 <capability action="POST" id="stop_server" name="stop_server" url="/servers/{serverId}/stop"/>
</capabilities>

actions.name: Remove Capabilities
actions.description: Remove capabilities from an endpoint template.
